info.title: Listen API: Podcast Search & Directory API
info.description: Simple & no-nonsense podcast search & directory API. Search all podcasts and episodes by people, places, or topics.

tags.name: Podcaster API
tags.description: Endpoints to improve the podcast database

get.description: Full-text search on episodes, podcasts, or curated lists of podcasts.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search term, e.g., person, place, topic... You can use double quotes to do verbatim match, e.g., "game of thrones". Otherwise, it's fuzzy search.

parameters.name: sort_by_date
parameters.description: Sort by date or not? If 0, then sort by relevance. If 1, then sort by date.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: What type of contents do you want to search for?

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for search results, for pagination. You'll use **next_offset** from response for this parameter.

parameters.name: len_min
parameters.description: Minimum audio length in minutes. Applicable only when type parameter is **episode**.

parameters.name: len_max
parameters.description: Maximum audio length in minutes. Applicable only when type parameter is **episode**.

parameters.name: genre_ids
parameters.description: A comma-delimited string of a list of genre ids. If not specified, then all genres are included. You can find the id and the name of all genres from `GET /genres`. It works only when **type** is *episode* or *podcast*.

parameters.name: published_before
parameters.description: Only show episodes/podcasts/curated lists published before this timestamp (in milliseconds). If **published_before** & **published_after** are used at the same time, **published_before** should be bigger than **published_after**.

parameters.name: published_after
parameters.description: Only show episodes/podcasts/curated lists published after this timestamp (in milliseconds). If **published_before** & **published_after** are used at the same time, **published_before** should be bigger than **published_after**.

parameters.name: only_in
parameters.description: A comma-delimited string to search only in specific fields. Allowed values are title, description, author, and audio. If not specified, then search every fields.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific language. If not specified, it'll be any language. You can get a list of supported languages from `GET /languages`. It works only when **type** is *episode* or *podcast*.

parameters.name: ocid
parameters.description: A podcast id (the **podcast_id** field in response). This parameter is to limit search results in a specific podcast. It works only when **type** is *episode*.

parameters.name: ncid
parameters.description: A podcast id (the **podcast_id** field in response). This parameter is to exclude search results from a specific podcast. It works only when **type** is *episode*.

parameters.name: safe_mode
parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. It works only when **type** is *episode* or *podcast*.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.description: Suggest search terms, podcast genres, and podcasts.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search term, e.g., person, place, topic... You can use double quotes to do verbatim match, e.g., "game of thrones". Otherwise, it's fuzzy search.

parameters.name: show_podcasts
parameters.description: Autosuggest podcasts. This only searches podcast title and publisher and returns very limited info of 5 podcasts. 1 is yes, 0 is no. It's a bit slow to autosuggest podcasts, so we turn it off by default. If show_podcasts=1, you can also pass iTunes id (e.g., 474722933) to the q parameter to fetch podcast meta data.

parameters.name: show_genres
parameters.description: Whether or not to autosuggest genres. 1 is yes, 0 is no.

parameters.name: safe_mode
parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts/episodes with explicit language. 1 is yes and 0 is no. It works only when **show_podcasts** is *1*.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch a list of best podcasts by genre
get.description:
Get a list of curated best podcasts by genre. You can get the genre ids from `GET /genres` endpoint.
This endpoint returns same data as https://www.listennotes.com/best-podcasts/

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: genre_id
parameters.description: You can get the id from `GET /genres`. If not specified, it'll be the overall best podcasts, which can be considered as a special genre.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of those podcasts in this genre.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Filter best podcasts by country/region. You can get the supported country codes from `GET /regions`.

parameters.name: safe_mode
parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts with explicit language. 1 is yes, and 0 is no.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch detailed meta data and episodes for a podcast by id
get.description:
Fetch detailed meta data and episodes for a specific podcast (up to 10 episodes each time).
You can use the **next_episode_pub_date** parameter to do pagination and fetch more episodes.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Podcast id. You can get podcast id from using other endpoints, e.g., `GET /search`, `GET /best_podcasts`...

parameters.name: next_episode_pub_date
parameters.description: For episodes pagination. It's the value of **next_episode_pub_date** from the response of last request. If not specified, just return latest 10 episodes or oldest 10 episodes, depending on the value of the **sort** parameter.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: How do you want to sort the episodes of this podcast?

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch detailed meta data for an episode by id
get.description: Fetch detailed meta data for a specific episode.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id for a specific episode. You can get episode id from using other endpoints, e.g., `GET /search`...

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

post.summary: Batch fetch basic meta data for episodes
post.description: Batch fetch basic meta data for up to 10 episodes. This endpoint could be used to implement custom playlists for individual episodes. For detailed meta data of an individual episode, you need to use `GET /episodes/{id}`.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

post.summary: Batch fetch basic meta data for podcasts
post.description:
Batch fetch basic meta data for up to 10 podcasts.
This endpoint could be used to build something like OPML import,
allowing users to import a bunch of podcasts via rss urls.
For detailed meta data (including episodes) of an individual podcast, you need to use `GET /podcasts/{id}`.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch a curated list of podcasts by id
get.description:
Get detailed meta data of all podcasts in a specific curated list.
This endpoint returns same data as https://www.listennotes.com/curated-podcasts/

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id for a specific curated list of podcasts. You can get the id from the response of `GET /search?type=curated` or `GET /curated_podcasts`.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch a list of podcast genres
get.description:
Get a list of podcast genres that are supported in Listen Notes.
The genre id can be passed to other endpoints as a parameter to get podcasts in a specific genre,
e.g., `GET /best_podcasts`, `GET /search`...
You may want to cache the list of genres on the client side.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch a list of supported countries/regions for best podcasts
get.description: It returns a dictionary of country codes (e.g., us, gb...) & country names (United States, United Kingdom...). The country code is used in the query parameter **region** of `GET /best_podcasts`.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.summary: Fetch a list of supported languages for podcasts
get.description: Get a list of languages that are supported in Listen Notes database. You can use the language string as query parameter in `GET /search`.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.description: Recently published episodes are more likely to be fetched. Good luck!

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

get.description: A bunch of curated lists from online media. For each list, you'll get basic info of up to 5 podcasts. To get detailed meta data of all podcasts in a specific list, you need to use `GET /curated_podcasts/{id}`. We add new curated lists to the database on a daily basis.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of curated lists.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

get.description: Fetch up to 8 podcast recommendations based on the given podcast id.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Podcast id.

parameters.name: safe_mode
parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts with explicit language. 1 is yes, and 0 is no.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Episode id.

parameters.name: safe_mode
parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts with explicit language. 1 is yes, and 0 is no.

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

404.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

post.summary: Submit a podcast to Listen Notes database
post.description: Podcast hosting services can use this endpoint to help your users directly submit a new podcast to Listen Notes database. If the podcast doesn't exist in the database, "status" in the response will be "in review", and we'll review it within 12 hours. If you specify the "email" parameter, we'll send a notification to this email once the podcast is accepted. If the podcast exist in the database, "status" in the response will be "found". You can use `POST /podcasts` to check if multiple podcasts exist in the database.

parameters.name: X-ListenAPI-Key
parameters.description: Get API Key on listennotes.com/api

401.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

429.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

description_highlighted.description: Highlighted segment of this episode's description
description_highlighted.example: ...Go to http://Patreon.com/sw7x7 to donate to the Star Wars 7x7 podcast, and you'll get some fabulous rewards for your pledge.*** Check out SW7x7.com for full Star Wars 7x7 show notes and links, and to

description_original.description: Plain text of this episode's description
description_original.example: Yeah, Star Wars Celebration Orlando is 32 days away, but what's the scoop on Celebration 2018? Plus, Rebels Day is Saturday, and much more in our update. Punch it! ***We're listener supported! Go to http://Patreon.com/sw7x7 to donate to the Star Wars 7x7 podcast, and youll get some fabulous rewards for your pledge.***  Check out SW7x7.com for full Star Wars 7x7 show notes and links, and to comment on any of the content of this episode! If you like what you've heard, please leave us a rating or review on iTunes or Stitcher, which will also help more people discover this Star Wars podcast. Don't forget to join the Star Wars 7x7 fun on Facebook at Facebook.com/SW7x7, and follow the breaking news Twitter feed at Twitter.com/SW7x7Podcast. We're also on Pinterest and Instagram as "SW7x7" too, and we'd love to connect with you there!

title_highlighted.description: Highlighted segment of this episode's title

title_original.description: Plain text of this episode' title

transcripts_highlighted.description: Up to 2 highlighted segments of the audio transcript of this episode.

items.example: 00:21:27 when Disney bought the Star Wars franchise from George Lucas they had a plan lots of Star Wars movies new Star Wars movies every month another one was just released while I was talking

description_highlighted.example: ...Join host Allen Voivod for Star Wars news, history, interviews, trivia, and deep dives into the Star Wars story as told in movies, books, comics, games, cartoons, and more.

description_original.example: The Star Wars 7x7 Podcast is Rebel-rousing fun for everyday Jedi, between 7 and 14 minutes a day, 7 days a week. Join host Allen Voivod for Star Wars news, history, interviews, trivia, and deep dives into the Star Wars story as told in movies, books, comics, games, cartoons, and more. Subscribe now for your daily dose of Star Wars joy. It's destiny unleashed! #SW7x7

description_highlighted.description: Highlighted segment of this curated list's description
description_highlighted.example: ...Star Wars fans in Reddit shared their favorite podcasts.

description_original.description: Plain text of this curated list's description
description_original.example: Star Wars fans in Reddit shared their favorite podcasts.

title_highlighted.description: Highlighted segment of this curated list's title
title_highlighted.example: What are some good Star Wars Podcast to listen to?

title_original.description: Plain text of this curated list's title
title_original.example: What are some good Star Wars Podcast to listen to?

podcasts.description: Up to 5 podcasts in this curated list.
Complete meta data of all podcasts in this curated list.
Minimum meta data of up to 5 podcasts in this curated list.

next_offset.description: Pass this value to the **offset** parameter to do pagination of search results.

took.description: The time it took to fetch these search results. In seconds.

total.description: The total number of search results.

count.description: The number of search results in this page.

genres.description: Genre suggestions. It'll show up when the **show_genres** parameter is *1*.

podcasts.description: Podcast suggestions. It'll show up when the **show_podcasts** parameter is 1.

show_latest_episodes.description: Whether or not to fetch up to 10 latest episodes from these podcasts, sorted by pub_date. 1 is yes, and 0 is no.

latest_episodes.description: Up to 10 latest episodes from these podcasts, sorted by **pub_date**. This field shows up only when **show_latest_episodes** is 1.

email.description: A valid email address. If **email** is specified, then we'll notify this email address once the podcast is accepted.

cohosts.description: Whether this podcast is looking for cohosts.

cross_promotion.description: Whether this podcast is looking for cross promotion opportunities with other podcasts.

sponsors.description: Whether this podcast is looking for sponsors.

guests.description: Whether this podcast is looking for guests.

youtube_url.description: YouTube url affiliated with this podcast

facebook_handle.description: Facebook username affiliated with this podcast

instagram_handle.description: Instagram username affiliated with this podcast

twitter_handle.description: Twitter username affiliated with this podcast

wechat_handle.description: WeChat username affiliated with this podcast

patreon_handle.description: Patreon username affiliated with this podcast

google_url.description: Google Podcasts url for this podcast

linkedin_url.description: LinkedIn url affiliated with this podcast

AudioField.description: Audio url of this episode, which can be played directly.

IsClaimedField.description: Whether this podcast is claimed by its producer on [ListenNotes.com](https://www.ListenNotes.com).

LanguageField.description: The language of this podcast. You can get all supported languages from `GET /languages`.

CountryField.description: The country where this podcast is produced.

MaybeAudioInvalidField.description: Whether or not this episode's audio is invalid. Podcasters may delete the original audio.

AudioLengthSecField.description: Audio length of this episode. In seconds.

TotalEpisodesField.description: Total number of episodes in this podcast.

ImageField.description:
Image url for this podcast's artwork. If you are using PRO plan, then it's
a high resolution image (1400x1400). If you are using FREE plan, then it's the same as **thumbnail**,
low resolution image (300x300).

ThumbnailField.description: Thumbnail image url for this podcast's artwork (300x300).

EmailField.description: The email of this podcast's producer

EpisodePubDateMsField.description: Published date for this episode. In millisecond.

CuratedPubDateMsField.description: Published date of this curated list. In milliseconds.

LatestPubDateMsField.description: The published date of the latest episode of this podcast. In milliseconds

EarliestPubDateMsField.description: The published date of the oldest episode of this podcast. In milliseconds

NextEpisodePubDateField.description: Passed to the **next_episode_pub_date** parameter of `GET /podcasts/{id}` to paginate through episodes of that podcast.

PodcastNameField.example: Star Wars 7x7 | Star Wars News, Interviews, and More!

EpisodeNameField.example: Celebration Recap, Jason Fry and Christian Blauvelt Interviews  SWBW #101

CuratedNameField.example: 7 Bookish Podcasts for Avid Readers On the Go

ExplicitField.description: Whether this podcast contains explicit language.

EpisodeLNUrlField.description: The url of this episode on [ListenNotes.com](https://www.ListenNotes.com).

EpisodeLNEditUrlField.description: Edit url of this episode where you can update the audio url if you find the audio is broken.

PodcastLNUrlField.description: The url of this podcast on [ListenNotes.com](https://www.ListenNotes.com).

CuratedLNUrlField.description: The url of this curated list on [ListenNotes.com](https://www.ListenNotes.com).

BestPodcastsLNUrlField.description: Url of the list of best podcasts on [ListenNotes.com](https://www.ListenNotes.com).

PublisherHighlightedField.description: Highlighted segment of this podcast's publisher name.
PublisherHighlightedField.example: Star Wars Daily, by Allen Voivod

PublisherOriginalField.description: Plain text of this podcast's publisher name.
PublisherOriginalField.example: Star Wars Daily, by Allen Voivod

PodcastTitleHighlightedField.example: Star Wars 7x7 | Star Wars News, Interviews, and More!

PodcastTitleOriginalField.example: Star Wars 7x7 | Star Wars News, Interviews, and More!

EpisodeDescriptionField.description: Html of this episode's full description
EpisodeDescriptionField.example:
Disney chief Bob Iger shared news about Star Wars movies in 2020 and beyond, but some media outlets gave conflicting reports about it. Here's the real scoop. Punch it!

***Were listener supported! Go to http://Patreon.com/sw7x7 to donate to the Star Wars 7x7 podcast, and youll get some fabulous rewards for your pledge.***

Check out SW7x7.com for full Star Wars 7x7 show notes and links, and to comment on any of the content of this episode! If you like what you've heard, please leave us a rating or review on iTunes or Stitcher, which will also help more people discover this Star Wars podcast.

Don't forget to join the Star Wars 7x7 fun on Facebook at Facebook.com/SW7x7, and follow the breaking news Twitter feed at Twitter.com/SW7x7Podcast. We're also on Pinterest and Instagram as "SW7x7" too, and we'd love to connect with you there!

PodcastDescriptionField.description: Html of this episode's full description
PodcastDescriptionField.example: The Star Wars 7x7 Podcast is Rebel-rousing fun for everyday Jedi, between 7 and 14 minutes a day, 7 days a week. Join host Allen Voivod for Star Wars news, history, interviews, trivia, and deep dives into the Star Wars story as told in movies, books, comics, games, cartoons, and more. Subscribe now for your daily dose of Star Wars joy. It's destiny unleashed!

CuratedDescriptionField.example: Commuting to work is always better when you have a great new podcast to listen to, and this year, we have discovered some of our favorite podcasts yet for readers and book-lovers. These podcasts for readers entertain us and provide no shortage of new book recommendations too.

CuratedSourceUrlField.description: Url of the source of this curated list.

CuratedSourceDomainField.description: The domain name of the source of this curated list.

NotFound.description: Endpoint not exist, or podcast / episode not exist

Unauthorized.description: Wrong api key or your account is suspended

TooManyRequests.description: You are using FREE plan and you exceed the quota limit

queryParam.name: q
queryParam.description: Search term, e.g., person, place, topic... You can use double quotes to do verbatim match, e.g., "game of thrones". Otherwise, it's fuzzy search.

safeModeParam.name: safe_mode
safeModeParam.description: Whether or not to exclude podcasts with explicit language. 1 is yes, and 0 is no.

genreIdParam.name: genre_id
genreIdParam.description: You can get the id from `GET /genres`. If not specified, it'll be the overall best podcasts, which can be considered as a special genre.

X-ListenAPI-FreeQuota.description: Free quotas of API requests included in your api plan.

X-ListenAPI-Usage.description: The number of API requests that you've used in current billing cycle.

X-listenAPI-Latency-Seconds.description: Latency for this api call, in seconds.

X-ListenAPI-NextBillingDate.description: The timestamp for the start of next billing cycle. In ISO 8601 format.
